reviews.text:
The gym could be theoretically good, and was glad to try it. But operations leave space for improvement:
Pros
Autobelays; nice tall walls for sport climbing (lead only) plus some bouldering
Cons
Very inconvenient location a significant amount of walking from nearest metro; hidden in an alley and hard to find; staff doesn't speak a word of English (btw I'm not a native speaker so this isn't colonialism); unfriendly couldn't give a damn staff; filthy bathrooms; water pooling on floor in parts of gym making a hazard (no one bothered with it); routes are inconsistently graded (boulders ok, ropes very sandbagged); little variety in climbing style featuring mostly slopers in the autobelay section; no wifi

What made the worst impression was when I asked to access wifi to call a cab. Instead of offering to let me use their phone, they sent me to walk alone at night down a dark alley in unfamiliar territory. I hope the management sacks these uncaring aholes.

As a solo traveler, the auto-belays were handy and allowed me to practice climbing by myself.

Booked a guide for some private training which was nice. I am a 5+/6a climber. 

They could have changed the holds more often, the walls had a bit of a run-down feel to them.

Was there in May and not many people in the center.
